result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Jermaine Watson

Defendant Michael Jermaine Watson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Michael Jermaine Watson.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  This case will be resolving globally in Br. 16.  Court authorized transfer of this case to Br. 16 for resolution only. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Michael Jermaine Watson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Michael Jermaine Watson.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.

Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Defendant has a felony case in Br. 16 and Atty. Wentz requests a status date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court, defendant Michael Jermaine Watson not in court, in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Wentz informed the Court the defendant is withdrawing request for Speedy Trial, and requests this matter be adjourned for status.  Court vacates the trial date of 9/12/22.  Case remains calendared in Br 1.  mn  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Haley Wentz notified the Court via email on 8/12/2022 stating she was recently appointed as counsel and is unavailable for the 9/6/2022 final pretrial. Court allows the 9/6/2022 final pretrial to be rescheduled to 8/19/2022 at 1:30pm.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court as a representative of the public defenders office, defendant Michael Jermaine Watson not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Status conference held. Defendant has filed a speedy trial demand, expires 9/19/2022. Court sets trial dates. Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael Jermaine Watson in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Michael Jermaine Watson in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Jermaine Watson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
